segments.text: I notice the intricate details of the kitchen—every dish, every cabinet—but the chaos is stealing my focus.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so tranquil in her task, but it’s the calm before the storm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a twinge of anger at the negligence, the way she’s oblivious to the disaster waiting to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t she just turn around and see what’s happening behind her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s determination is admirable, yet frustrating because he doesn’t see the risks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel the tension building in the air, a heavy weight like a balloon about to pop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside seems to mock the chaos inside, a perfect world juxtaposed with this impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
